website_summaries.verdict: The Targhee Vent Mid is a day hiking boot complimented for its good ventilation, spacious forefoot, and satisfying comfort. These were just a few reasons why outdoor enthusiasts find it to be a sensible purchase. Despite these favorable points, more than a couple of setbacks were raised.All things considered, it seems that future owners of the KEEN Targhee Vent Mid are those who do not mind replacing the insole and sizing up. With these interventions, one may genuinely be able to enjoy its features.
pros: Several brand loyalists were sold on its comfort, making them want to get another pair
The KEEN Targhee Vent Mid was worth the purchase, based on a handful of online buyers
Some hikers mentioned that it has plenty of grip
The minimal break-in period of the KEEN Targhee Vent Mid won the hearts of numerous wearers
A bunch of owners were grateful for its roomy toe box
They liked how it offered ample space for toe splaying
The breathability of this hiking boot was appreciated by a lot of users
cons: The stock insole of the Targhee Vent Mid brought disappointment to a number of verified purchasers with its lack of cushioning
A couple of those who bought the pair commented that after wearing it for a few miles, the rubber toe cap began to peel off

customer_reviews.title: Great Light Weight Boot
customer_reviews.text: The material and stitching is classic high quality Keen. By eliminating the traditional heavy material used on most hiking boots, these boots breath easier (and are much lighter). My feet never overheated while wearing them for 8+ hours a day, on trails, roads and fields. The ankle support is a plus for uneven and moderately rugged terrain. If you are debating between low rise versus over the ankle based on weight, yet need the additional support, buy these boots. You will get everything you want and need. I like these boots, and would recommend them to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Almost the same fit as the waterproof Targhee II
customer_reviews.text: Own both Targhee II and III, and the III is definitely narrower. Width is important as an old foot injury needs more toe box space. Always like Keen and needed a breathable and cooler pair for a late summer Camino so thought to try the Vent. Fits a lot more like the waterproof Targhee II and is much cooler without the Keen Dry membrane.
customer_reviews.author: DBC.

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, breathable, comfortable
customer_reviews.text: If I could only ever wear Keen’s, I would. The support and fit is great, comfortable and sturdy (mostly). Like the Weight of them, and the ventilation. Comfortable throughout the summer. Of course not WP, but there’s a different Targhee model for that. Sometimes you get a pair that will last forever. Sometimes they last a year or so. I’ve found that the work models last longer. Others the heel designs start to separate. Still would only want to wear Keen’s everyday.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Crowthers

customer_reviews.title: Men’s Size 7 a great substitute for Women’s Size 9 Wide
customer_reviews.text: I would like to Preface this with.... I wear a woman’s size 9 wide and finding the right hiking shoe is almost impossible for me. I found that men’s size 7 fit perfectly and the toe box fit like a glove! I’ve only worn these around town to break them in and get the feel of them. At this point I can say they are beyond my expectations. The feel Of the shoe is lightweight. The cushioning in the tongue is perfect for my foot. No slipping no forward movement in the shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Anita Landon

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: the shoes were bought as preparation for the hiking season, but i have not been out hiking with them yet. they are light and vented and how they are vented. I used it several time for biking in Feb and Mar in Utah and my feet got cold pretty cold. Ankle support is a weak point, i think it's minimal but better than none. I notice that they are a bit slippery on wet _coated_ concrete, so i would assume that they will be also slippery on wet rocks. They fit as expected with a comfortable toe box. The quality seems to be good, i hope they will hold up like the other Keens shoes i have.
customer_reviews.author: Bambine

customer_reviews.title: Nice boots but a bit cheap in appearance.
customer_reviews.text: I like these boots for light hiking and even for working in the backyard. The toebox is a bit too roomy but lacing them tighter keeps my feet from slipping. I haven't done a long downhill yet, I am not sure how they would perform there. The insole is stout and the arch support is good. The material looks a bit cheap but they are fairly stoutly built. The toecap looks very sturdy, which is important because having the toecap separate is a fairly common way boots wear out. The tread is patterned well and the traction is solid. My size 13's weigh 2.6 pounds so they are fairly light. I like. They may just grow on me.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Boot for Wide Feet.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent boot and all day comfort. I usually wear a wide or extra wide but Keen boots fit wider than other brands, even in the regular width. I usually wear an 11 Wide but ordered the 11.5 regular width and they fit perfectly. Plenty of room in the toe box as it’s a square design that lends to better fit for wide feet. These are very light weight and feel very stable under the feet. Overall one of the best boots for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony T.

customer_reviews.title: Great at what they're designed to do
customer_reviews.text: These boots are really rugged. Tested them in the wilderness around Wheeler Peak NM on a backpacking trip. Put roughly 25 miles on them. They easily handle mud, sharp granite stones on the trail, and grip on loose gravel. They fit as expected and kept my toes warm in the 40 degree mornings without thick socks. For mild, non-snowy trips, or trips when you don't need to cross a lot of water, I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Stephens

customer_reviews.title: Trying to replace my construction boots with something lighter
customer_reviews.text: These boots are 7/10 on comfort and only weigh 2 pounds compared to my 3.5 pound construction boots. The reason for only 2 stars is they don't breathe at all. I bought these for the name "vent" but they don't vent at all. My feet are cold and wet at the end of every day from sweat. Im now stuck with a brand new $120 pair of shoes that I have to drill small holes in or something to actually vent.
customer_reviews.author: Neal P

customer_reviews.title: Nice that this boot ventilates
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing the KEEN Men's Targhee II Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot for years. I will enjoy this boot's ventilation aspect. Fits well, as expected. Looks good!
customer_reviews.author: --SJ

customer_reviews.title: I needed a comfortable walking/light hiking boot ... this Works!
customer_reviews.text: I have enjoyed the Keen brand sandle... I tried this boot and am enjoying it. No break down after a year+ use. (I have found it difficult to find a good, lower-priced hiking boot. A lot of total junk out there. This one won't disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: Rich P

customer_reviews.title: Won’t wear anything else when hiking!
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes! I first discovered these about four uears ago when my wife and I bought them for a trip to Zions National Park. I have been purchasing them ever since. They are very comfortable, and get me through the hikes every time. I tend to wear my shoes out quickly, as the terrain I generally hike in is covered with razor sharp rocks, but they are well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Poulson

customer_reviews.title: Very light ventilated boot
customer_reviews.text: Very confortable and cool boot. It allows your feet to breathe while still providing adequate support for your ankles. I live in the tropics and is very rare to find a boot that won’t cook your feet after all day wear.
customer_reviews.author: Arqguy

customer_reviews.title: Love the fit of these - box toe but
customer_reviews.text: I love the fit and the feel of these BUT they are slippery when wet. its odd that nice expensive hiking boot would be slippery. but every Keen Ive ever had seems to be slippery...even on non slip floors you can feel them slip a little I have a few pairs and its all Keens
customer_reviews.author: GREG

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Great comfortable boot. Just did 9 days of tracking in Peru
customer_reviews.author: TomH

customer_reviews.title: Great boot
customer_reviews.text: Very well vented for a mid boot. Not to hot in warm weather. Same keen quality.
customer_reviews.author: James Hill

customer_reviews.title: Good boots
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of these. I like the roomy toe box, and they fit and wear great. They breathe without letting in a bunch of sand and dirt
customer_reviews.author: Charles Crocker

customer_reviews.title: Size seems true in this model.
customer_reviews.text: Good fit using my regular shoe size. Nice support and plenty of toe room. No break-in required. Very pleased as I am a first time user.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy T

customer_reviews.title: boot
customer_reviews.text: keen the best boot ever this my second pare this month.....................................
customer_reviews.author: Albert Ramos

customer_reviews.title: Pretty fit
customer_reviews.text: I do like the shoe but it's almost to soft in frame of the shoe and for me difficult to walk in need more support
customer_reviews.author: Ken Stone

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Love them! So comfortable right out of the box! Great Ventilation!
customer_reviews.author: Jason Bergquist

customer_reviews.title: Quality boot.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice boot. Good air circulation and comfortable to wear all day.
customer_reviews.author: Justin D. Garziano

customer_reviews.title: Keen makes a good shoe/boot.
customer_reviews.text: Nice fir, good traction. Took about a week to break in.
customer_reviews.author: EW

customer_reviews.title: Pleased from initial inspection!
customer_reviews.text: Great style! High quality! Breathable! Fit as expected! Can't wait to give these a go on a few hikes!
customer_reviews.author: ShoupJ

customer_reviews.title: Lumpy boots
customer_reviews.text: Had a strange lump in the middle of the left shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Trash Man

customer_reviews.title: K9 handler approved
customer_reviews.text: Awesome boots I wear them for work as a K9 handler I put 50mi a week on them.
customer_reviews.author: James Kirkpatrick

customer_reviews.title: Questioning the workmanship of the shoe
customer_reviews.text: the stitching on the toe actually came unstitched within the first 2 weeks. I return them bought another pair it's only been a week so we'll see how these hold up maybe it was just a bad pair
customer_reviews.author: sheila bembenek

customer_reviews.title: Lace hook at top of boot
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these boot 4/2020 and top lace hook broke. Have tried to contact Keen with no luck. Tried calling and chat and no response. Will have to think hard about buying Keen foot wear again.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel J. Brown

customer_reviews.title: I do not recommend
customer_reviews.text: with only 1 month of use. I do not recommend
customer_reviews.author: Kleber Lopes Benites

customer_reviews.title: Keen Appears to be Using It's Amazon Store to Sell Returns as New
customer_reviews.text: The pair of shoes I received was clearly used. There was a stick caught in the tread. There was also a handwritten post-it note in the box. The shoes were laced and had no paper or cardboard insert inside. C'mon guys.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Goldenrod

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with the boots
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with the boots. Only worn them a few times. Comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Rose Lueth

customer_reviews.title: Texas
customer_reviews.text: too soon to tell amgo, I've only had them 2 weeks, but so far, they look great & feel great
customer_reviews.author: Amando Estrada Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: I think I would Get them again. They fit great!
customer_reviews.author: Storm C.

customer_reviews.title: good price
customer_reviews.text: the arch on one foot hurt. I changed the insert and it was ok
customer_reviews.author: lisa kamieniecki

customer_reviews.title: Great quality & fit
customer_reviews.text: My son loves these boots, he has worn this style for years.
customer_reviews.author: MJB Tulsa

customer_reviews.title: Tracking shoes Keen
customer_reviews.text: Its very good seller. The shoes like me. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Oli

product_meta.title: KEEN Men's, Targhee Vent Mid Hiking Boots Cork Gold 7 M
feature_bullets: Water resistant, oiled nubuck leather upper
Speed hooks, for easy lace adjustment
Injected TPU heel-capture system for stability
